intro: Gilia latiflora, commonly known as the broadleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often blooming in summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along streambanks. Gilia latiflora is also known for its use in traditional medicine by indigenous peoples.
